content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return lowercase(replace(strip(col), r"[\s-]+" => "_"))
end
```

This function first converts all characters to lower case, then it removes leading and trailing white spaces using the `strip` function. The regular expression `r"[\s-]+"` is used to replace any sequence of space or hyphens with a single underscore. Finally, `replace` replaces each occurrence of this pattern in string col with an underscore.
